intro: Onobrychis visianii, commonly known as the yellow burclover, is a perennial legume native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces small, hairy pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it valuable for soil enrichment and ecological restoration.
